verses.text: When Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father in law, heard of all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel his people, \add and\add* that the \sc Lord\sc* had brought Israel out of Egypt;
then Jethro, Moses’ father in law, took Zipporah, Moses’ wife, after he had sent her \add back\add*,
and her two sons; of which the name of the one \add was\add* Gershom; for he said, I have been an alien in a strange land:
and the name of the other \add was\add* Eliezer; for the God of my father, \add said he, was\add* mine help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh:
and Jethro, Moses’ father in law, came with his sons and his wife unto Moses into the wilderness, where he encamped \add at\add* the mount of God:
and he said unto Moses, I thy father in law Jethro am come unto thee, and thy wife, and her two sons with her.
And Moses went out to meet his father in law, and did obeisance, and kissed him; and they asked each other of \add their\add* welfare; and they came into the tent.

And Moses told his father in law all that the \sc Lord\sc* had done unto Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, \add and\add* all the travail that had come upon them by the way, and \add how\add* the \sc Lord\sc* delivered them.
And Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which the \sc Lord\sc* had done to Israel, whom he had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.

And Jethro said, Blessed \add be\add* the \sc Lord\sc*, who hath delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh, who hath delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
Now I know that the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* greater than all gods: for in the thing wherein they dealt proudly \add he was\add* above them.
And Jethro, Moses’ father in law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God: and Aaron came, and all the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses’ father in law before God.
And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses sat to judge the people: and the people stood by Moses from the morning unto the evening.

And when Moses’ father in law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What \add is\add* this thing that thou doest to the people? why sittest thou thyself alone, and all the people stand by thee from morning unto even?
And Moses said unto his father in law, Because the people come unto me to inquire of God:
when they have a matter, they come unto me; and I judge between one and another, and I do make \add them\add* know the statutes of God, and his laws.
And Moses’ father in law said unto him, The thing that thou doest \add is\add* not good.
Thou wilt surely wear away, both thou, and this people that \add is\add* with thee: for \add this\add* thing \add is\add* too heavy for thee; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone.
Hearken now unto my voice, I will give thee counsel, and God shall be with thee: be thou for the people to God-ward, that thou mayest bring the causes unto God:
and thou shalt teach them ordinances and laws, and shalt shew them the way \add wherein\add* they must walk, and the work that they must do.

Moreover thou shalt provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating covetousness; and place \add such\add* over them, \add to be\add* rulers of thousands, \add and\add* rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens:

and let them judge the people at all seasons: and it shall be, \add that\add* every great matter they shall bring unto thee, but every small matter they shall judge: so shall it be easier for thyself, and they shall bear \add the burden\add* with thee.
If thou shalt do this thing, and God command thee \add so\add*, then thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people shall also go to their place in peace.
So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father in law, and did all that he had said.
And Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
And they judged the people at all seasons: the hard causes they brought unto Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.
And Moses let his father in law depart; and he went his way into his own land.
